title: Method, Concepts of

articles.content: A special subcategory of concepts pertaining to the products of consciousness, is reserved for concepts of method. Concepts of method designate systematic courses of action devised by men for the purpose of achieving certain goals. The course of action may be purely psychological (such as a method of using one’s consciousness) or it may involve a combination of psychological and physical actions (such as a method of drilling for oil), according to the goal to be achieved.
articles.attribution:
“Concepts of Consciousness,”
Introduction to Objectivist Epistemology, 35–36
